skill.name: regulatory-affairs-head
skill.description: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager expertise for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides strategic regulatory guidance, submission management, regulatory pathway analysis, global compliance coordination, and cross-functional team leadership. Use for regulatory strategy development, submission planning, regulatory risk assessment, and team coordination activities.
skill.summary: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager expertise for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides strategic...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 76 static findings are false positives. The scanner incorrectly flagged regulatory documentation terminology (Module C2, Annex II, design controls) as security keywords and mistook markdown code fences for shell execution. The Python script performs standard JSON file I/O for local submission tracking. No malicious code exists.

content.user_title: Lead Regulatory Strategy for Medical Devices
content.value_statement: Medical device companies face complex global regulatory requirements that delay market access and increase compliance costs. This skill provides expert regulatory affairs guidance for FDA submissions, EU MDR compliance, ISO certifications, and cross-functional team coordination.
actual_capabilities: Develop comprehensive regulatory strategies for FDA 510(k), PMA, and EU MDR submissions
Coordinate cross-functional regulatory teams across product development lifecycle
Manage regulatory submission timelines and track approval progress
Conduct regulatory risk assessments and create mitigation plans
Prepare regulatory authority communications and documentation
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or replace regulatory consultants for specific submissions
Cannot submit regulatory documents to authorities on your behalf
Does not access real-time regulatory databases or authority systems
Assumes user has access to current regulatory guidance documents

use_cases.title: Build Regulatory Foundation
use_cases.description: Develop initial regulatory strategy and identify submission pathways for novel medical devices entering global markets.

use_cases.title: Optimize Submission Process
use_cases.description: Streamline FDA and EU MDR submission preparation, track progress, and coordinate cross-functional teams.

use_cases.title: Prepare for Certification Audits
use_cases.description: Coordinate ISO 13485 certification readiness and manage regulatory authority inspection preparation.

prompt_templates.title: Regulatory Strategy Development
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me develop a regulatory strategy for a [device type] targeting [markets]. The device is classified as [Class I/II/III] and has these key features: [list features]. What submission pathways should I consider and what is the estimated timeline?

prompt_templates.title: FDA Submission Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through the 510(k) submission process for a [device type]. I need to identify a predicate device, understand substantial equivalence requirements, and create a preparation checklist.

prompt_templates.title: EU MDR Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me understand EU MDR 2017/745 requirements for my [Class I/IIa/IIb/III] medical device. What technical documentation do I need and how do I engage with a Notified Body?

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Functional Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a regulatory coordination plan for my cross-functional team. We have [departments involved] working on [device name]. What meetings, deliverables, and handoff points do we need?

output_examples.input: Help me plan a 510(k) submission for a blood glucose monitoring system
output: Classification: Class II device with special controls
Predicates to consider: Common commercially available glucose meters
Key content requirements: Analytical performance, clinical accuracy, labeling
Estimated timeline: 6-12 months from predicate identification to submission
Cross-functional inputs needed: Engineering (performance data), Clinical (accuracy studies), Quality (design controls), Marketing (labeling)

output_examples.input: What are the key differences between FDA De Novo and 510(k)?
output: 510(k): Requires predicate device, substantial equivalence demonstration, faster review (90 days)
De Novo: No predicate exists, risk-benefit analysis required, creates new classification (180+ days)
Decision factors: Novelty of device, risk profile, available predicates, strategic classification goals

output_examples.input: Help me create a regulatory risk assessment for a Class II device
output: Market access risks: Timeline delays, Notified Body capacity, regulatory changes
Technical risks: Clinical data gaps, predicate availability, labeling compliance
Mitigation strategies: Early authority engagement, contingency predicates, robust clinical evidence
Monitoring plan: Quarterly regulatory intelligence reviews, timeline checkpoints

best_practices: Start regulatory strategy early in product development to inform design decisions and avoid costly rework
Engage with regulatory authorities through pre-submission meetings to validate pathway and identify concerns
Maintain comprehensive documentation throughout development to support both FDA and EU MDR requirements
anti_patterns: Waiting until late-stage development to begin regulatory planning, which creates timeline pressure and design constraints
Using outdated regulatory guidance without checking for recent changes or new requirements
Treating regulatory affairs as an isolated function rather than integrating it across product development

faq.question: What markets does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill covers FDA (US), EU MDR, ISO standards, and general global regulatory pathways for medical devices and HealthTech products.

faq.question: Can this skill prepare my actual regulatory submission?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides strategic guidance and templates. You must prepare actual submission documents using current authority templates and guidelines.

faq.question: Does this skill replace a regulatory consultant?
faq.answer: No, this skill augments regulatory knowledge but does not provide legal advice or replace specialized consultants for complex submissions.

faq.question: What device classes are supported?
faq.answer: All device classes (I, II, III) for both FDA and EU MDR classification systems are covered with appropriate pathways and requirements.

faq.question: How does this skill handle software as medical device (SaMD)?
faq.answer: The skill includes specific guidance for SaMD including FDA software documentation requirements and cybersecurity considerations.

faq.question: What tracking capabilities are included?
faq.answer: The included regulatory_tracker.py script helps monitor submission status, track deadlines, and generate compliance reports locally.
